turns.raw_header: You used the tag `!<q>` before your message. That isn’t a standard, widely-used command syntax I recognize, but I can still respond normally to the content that follows it.
turns.body:
Your message content is:

> test

I’m here and working. If you were just checking that, it succeeded.
turns.footer: If `!<q>` is meant to trigger a specific behavior (e.g., “answer concisely,” “treat this as a quote,” etc.), tell me what you intend it to do and I’ll adapt.

parsed_footer.raw: If `!<q>` is meant to trigger a specific behavior (e.g., “answer concisely,” “treat this as a quote,” etc.), tell me what you intend it to do and I’ll adapt.

turns.raw_header: You used `!<o>` this time. Like `!<q>`, that’s not a standard command I inherently know, but I’ll treat the rest as your message:
turns.body:
> second test

I’m still receiving and responding correctly.
turns.footer: If `!<o>` is supposed to mean something specific (like “give a one-line answer” or “roleplay output”), tell me and I’ll follow that convention.

parsed_footer.raw: If `!<o>` is supposed to mean something specific (like “give a one-line answer” or “roleplay output”), tell me and I’ll follow that convention.
